intro: Myrsine roraimae, commonly known as Roraima myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically in the region of Roraima in Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of the forest understory. Myrsine roraimae plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food and shelter for various insect and bird species.
